genotyping.title: Genotyping

run_genotyping.description: Specify to turn on genotyping of BAM files.
run_genotyping.help_text: Specify to turn on genotyping. `--genotyping_source` and `--genotyping_tool` must also be provided together with this option.

genotyping_source.description: Specify which input BAM to use for genotyping.
genotyping_source.help_text:
Specify which BAM file to use for genotyping, depending on what BAM processing modules you have turned on. Options are: 'raw' (to use the reads used as input for damage manipulation); 'pmd' (for pmdtools output); 'trimmed' (for base-clipped BAMs. Base-clipped-PMD-filtered BAMs if both filtering and trimming are requested); 'rescaled' (for mapDamage2 rescaling output).
Warning: Depending on the parameters you provided, 'raw' can refer to all mapped reads, filtered reads (if BAM filtering has been performed), or the deduplicated reads (if deduplication was performed).

genotyping_tool.help_text:
Specify which genotyper to use. Current options are: pileupCaller, ANGSD, GATK UnifiedGenotyper (v3.5), GATK HaplotypeCaller (v4) or FreeBayes.

> Note that while UnifiedGenotyper is more suitable for low-coverage ancient DNA (HaplotypeCaller does de novo assembly around each variant site), be aware GATK v3.5 it is officially deprecated by the Broad Institute (but is used here for compatibility with MultiVCFAnalyzer).

skip_bcftools_stats.description: Specify to skip generation of VCF-based variant calling statistics with bcftools.
skip_bcftools_stats.help_text:
Specify to disable running of `bcftools stats` against VCF files from GATK and FreeBayes genotypers.

This will automatically include the FASTA reference for INDEL-related statistics.

genotyping_reference_ploidy.description: Specify the ploidy of the reference organism.
genotyping_reference_ploidy.help_text:
Specify the desired ploidy value of your reference organism for genotyping with GATK or FreeBayes. E.g. if you want to allow heterozygous calls this value should be >= 2.

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper parameter: `--sample_ploidy`
> Modifies GATK HaplotypeCaller parameter: `--sample-ploidy`
> Modifies FreeBayes parameter: `-p`

genotyping_pileupcaller_min_base_quality.description: Specify the base mapping quality to be used for genotyping with pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_min_base_quality.help_text:
Specify the minimum base quality to be used when generating the samtools mpileup used as input for genotyping with pileupCaller.

> Modifies samtools mpileup parameter: `-Q`.

genotyping_pileupcaller_min_map_quality.description: Specify the minimum mapping quality to be used for genotyping with pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_min_map_quality.help_text:
Specify the minimum mapping quality to be used when generating the samtools mpileup used as input for genotyping with pileupCaller.

> Modifies samtools mpileup parameter: `-q`.

genotyping_pileupcaller_bedfile.help_text: Specify a SNP panel in the form of a BED file of sites at which to generate a pileup for pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_bedfile.description: Specify the path to SNP panel in BED format for pileupCaller.

genotyping_pileupcaller_snpfile.help_text: Specify a SNP panel in [EIGENSTRAT](https://github.com/DReichLab/EIG/blob/master/CONVERTF/README) format of sites to be called with pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_snpfile.description: Specify the path to SNP panel in EIGENSTRAT format for pileupCaller.

genotyping_pileupcaller_method.description: Specify the SNP calling method to use for genotyping with pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_method.help_text:
Specify the SNP calling method to use for genotyping. 'randomHaploid' will randomly sample a read overlapping the SNP and produce a homozygous genotype with the allele supported by that read (often called 'pseudohaploid' or 'pseudodiploid'). 'randomDiploid` will randomly sample two reads overlapping the SNP and produce a genotype comprised of the two alleles supported by the two reads. 'majorityCall' will produce a genotype that is homozygous for the allele that appears in the majority of reads overlapping the SNP.

> Modifies pileupCaller parameters: `--randomHaploid` `--randomDiploid` `--majorityCall`

genotyping_pileupcaller_transitions_mode.description: Specify the calling mode for transitions with pileupCaller.
genotyping_pileupcaller_transitions_mode.help_text:
Specify if genotypes of transition SNPs should be called, set to missing, or excluded from the genotypes respectively.

> Modifies pileupCaller parameter: `--skipTransitions` `--transitionsMissing`

genotyping_gatk_call_conf.help_text:
Specify a GATK genotyper phred-scaled confidence threshold of a given SNP/INDEL call.

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper or HaplotypeCaller parameter: `-stand_call_conf`

genotyping_gatk_dbsnp.help_text: Specify VCF file for output VCF SNP annotation, e.g. if you want to annotate your VCF file with 'rs' SNP IDs. Check GATK documentation for more information. Gzip not accepted.
genotyping_gatk_dbsnp.description: Specify VCF file for SNP annotation of output VCF files for GATK.

genotyping_gatk_ug_downsample.description: Specify the maximum depth coverage allowed for genotyping with GATK before down-sampling is turned on.
genotyping_gatk_ug_downsample.help_text:
Specify the maximum depth coverage allowed for genotyping before down-sampling is turned on. Any position with a coverage higher than this value will be randomly down-sampled to this many reads.

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper parameter: `-dcov`

genotyping_gatk_ug_out_mode.help_text:
Specify GATK UnifiedGenotyper output mode to use when producing the output VCF (i.e. produce calls for every site or just confidence sites.)

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper parameter: `--output_mode`

genotyping_gatk_ug_genotype_mode.help_text:
Specify GATK UnifiedGenotyper likelihood model, i.e. whether to call only SNPs or INDELS etc.

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper parameter: `--genotype_likelihoods_model`

genotyping_gatk_ug_keeprealignbam.description: Specify to keep the BAM output of re-alignment around variants from GATK UnifiedGenotyper.
genotyping_gatk_ug_keeprealignbam.help_text:
Specify to output the BAMs that have realigned reads (with GATK (v3) IndelRealigner) around possible variants for improved genotyping with GATK UnifiedGenotyper in addition to the standard VCF output.

These BAMs will be stored in the same folder as the corresponding VCF files.

genotyping_gatk_ug_defaultbasequalities.description: Specify to supply a default base quality if a read is missing a base quality score.
genotyping_gatk_ug_defaultbasequalities.help_text:
Specify a value to set base quality scores for genotyping with GATK UnifiedGenotyper, if reads are missing this information. Might be useful if you have 'synthetically' generated reads (e.g. chopping up a reference genome). Default is set to `-1` which is to not set any default quality (turned off).

> Modifies GATK UnifiedGenotyper parameter: `--defaultBaseQualities`

genotyping_gatk_hc_out_mode.help_text:
Specify the type of sites that should be included in the output VCF after genotyping with GATK HaplotypeCaller (i.e. produce calls for every site or just confidence sites).

> Modifies GATK HaplotypeCaller parameter: `--output_mode`

genotyping_gatk_hc_emitrefconf.description: Specify HaplotypeCaller mode for emitting reference confidence calls.
genotyping_gatk_hc_emitrefconf.help_text:
Specify GATK HaplotypeCaller mode for emitting reference confidence calls.

> Modifies GATK HaplotypeCaller parameter: `--emit-ref-confidence`

genotyping_freebayes_min_alternate_count.description: Specify minimum required supporting observations of an alternate allele to consider a variant in FreeBayes.
genotyping_freebayes_min_alternate_count.help_text:
Specify the minimum count of observations supporting an alternate allele within a single individual in order to evaluate the position during genotyping with FreeBayes.

> Modifies FreeBayes parameter: `-C`

genotyping_freebayes_skip_coverage.description: Specify to skip over regions of high depth by discarding alignments overlapping positions where total read depth is greater than specified in FreeBayes.
genotyping_freebayes_skip_coverage.help_text:
Specify to skip over regions of high depth by discarding alignments overlapping positions where total read depth is greater than the specified value during genotyping with FreeBayes. This is set to 0 by default, which deactivates this behaviour.

> Modifies FreeBayes parameter: `-g`

genotyping_angsd_glmodel.description: Specify which ANGSD genotyping likelihood model to use.
genotyping_angsd_glmodel.help_text:
Specify which genotype likelihood model to use in ANGSD.

> Modifies ANGSD parameter: `-GL`

genotyping_angsd_glformat.description: Specify the formatting of the output VCF for ANGSD genotype likelihood results.
genotyping_angsd_glformat.help_text:
Specifies what type of genotyping likelihood file format will be output by ANGSD.

The options refer to the following descriptions respectively:

- `binary`: binary output of all 10 log genotype likelihood
- `beagle_binary`: beagle likelihood file
- `binary_three`: binary 3 times likelihood
- `text`: text output of all 10 log genotype likelihoods.

See the [ANGSD documentation](http://www.popgen.dk/angsd/) for more information on which to select for your downstream applications.

> Modifies ANGSD parameter: `-doGlf`

genotyping.help_text:
There are options for different genotypers (or genotype likelihood calculators) to be used. We suggest you read the documentation of each tool to find the ones that suit your needs.

Documentation for each tool:

- GATK UnifiedGenotyper
- GATK HaplotypeCaller
- FreeBayes
- sequenceTools pileupCaller

Genotyping is performed per sample (i.e. after all types of libraries are merged), except for pileupCaller which gathers all double-stranded and single-stranded (same-type merged) libraries respectively.
Some genotypers require additional files to be specified in the reference sheet, or using command line parameters. When using a reference sheet, only references with the required filed specified in the respective columns will be used for genotyping.

mitochondrial_to_nuclear_ratio.title: Mitochondrial to Nuclear Ratio
mitochondrial_to_nuclear_ratio.description: Options for the calculation of ratio of reads to one chromosome/FASTA entry against all others.
mitochondrial_to_nuclear_ratio.help_text: If using TSV input, Mitochondrial to Nuclear Ratio calculation is calculated per deduplicated library (after lane merging)

run_mtnucratio.description: Specify to turn on mitochondrial to nuclear ratio calculation.
run_mtnucratio.help_text: Specify to turn on estimation of the ratio of mitochondrial to nuclear reads.

mitochondrion_header.description: Specify the name of the reference FASTA entry corresponding to the mitochondrial genome.
mitochondrion_header.help_text: Specify the FASTA entry in the reference file specified as `--fasta`, which acts as the mitochondrial 'chromosome' to base the ratio calculation on. The tool only accepts the first section of the header before the first space. The default chromosome name is based on hs37d5/GrCH37 human reference genome.

mapping_statistics.title: Mapping statistics
mapping_statistics.description: Options for the calculation of mapping statistics

mapstats_skip_preseq.help_text: Specify to turn off the computation of library complexity estimation.
mapstats_skip_preseq.description: Specify to turn off the computation of library complexity estimation with preseq.

mapstats_preseq_mode.help_text:
Specify which mode of preseq to run.

From the [preseq documentation](http://smithlabresearch.org/wp-content/uploads/manual.pdf):

c curve is used to compute the expected complexity curve of a mapped read file with a hypergeometric formula

lc extrap is used to generate the expected yield for theoretical larger experiments and bounds on the number of distinct reads in the library and the associated confidence intervals, which is computed by bootstrapping the observed duplicate counts histogram.
mapstats_preseq_mode.description: Specify which mode of preseq to run.

mapstats_preseq_stepsize.description: Specify the step size (i.e., sampling regularity) of preseq.
mapstats_preseq_stepsize.help_text:
Specify the step size of preseq's c_curve and lc_extrap methods. This can be useful when few reads are present and allow preseq to be used for extrapolation of shallow sequencing results.


> Modifies preseq parameter:
> `-s`

mapstats_preseq_terms.help_text:
Specify the maximum number of terms that preseq's lc_extrap mode will use.

> Modifies preseq lc_extrap parameter: `-x`
mapstats_preseq_terms.description: Specify the maximum number of terms that preseq's lc_extrap mode will use.

mapstats_preseq_maxextrap.help_text:
Specify the maximum extrapolation that preseq's lc_extrap mode will perform.

> Modifies preseq lc_extrap parameter: `-e`
mapstats_preseq_maxextrap.description: Specify the maximum extrapolation to use for preseq's lc_extrap mode.

mapstats_preseq_bootstrap.help_text:
Specify the number of bootstraps preseq's lc_extrap mode will perform to calculate confidence intervals.

> Modifies preseq lc_extrap parameter: `-n`
mapstats_preseq_bootstrap.description: Specify number of bootstraps to perform in preseq's lc_extrap mode.

mapstats_preseq_cval.help_text:
Specify the allowed level of confidence intervals used for prerseq's lc_extrap mode.

> Modifies preseq lc_extrap parameter: `-c`
mapstats_preseq_cval.description: Specify confidence interval level for preseq's lc_extrap mode.

mapstats_preseq_defects_mode.description: Specify to turn on preseq defects mode to extrapolate without testing for defects in lc_extrap mode.
mapstats_preseq_defects_mode.help_text:
Specify to activate defects mode of `preseq lc_extrap`, which runs the extrapolation without testing for defects.

> Modifies preseq lc_extrap parameter: `-D`

skip_qualimap.description: Specify to turn off coverage calculation with Qualimap.

snpcapture_bed.description: Specify path to SNP capture positions in BED format for coverage calculations with Qualimap.

adna_damage_analysis.title: (aDNA) Damage Analysis
adna_damage_analysis.description: Options for calculating and filtering for characteristic ancient DNA damage patterns.
adna_damage_analysis.help_text:
More documentation can be found at the follow links for:

[DamageProfiler](https://github.com/Integrative-Transcriptomics/DamageProfiler)

If using TSV input, DamageProfiler is performed per library, i.e. after lane merging. BAM Trimming is only performed on non-UDG and half-UDG treated data.

skip_damagecalculation.help_text: Specify to turn off computation of DNA damage profiles.
skip_damagecalculation.description: Specify to turn off ancient DNA damage calculation.

damagecalculation_tool.description: Specify the tool to use for damage calculation.
damagecalculation_tool.help_text: Specify the tool to be used for damage calculation. DamageProfiler is generally faster than mapDamage2, but the latter has an option to limit the number of reads used. This can significantly speed up the processing of very large files, where the damage estimates are already accurate after processing only a fraction of the input.

damagecalculation_yaxis.description: Specify the maximum misincorporation frequency that should be displayed on damage plot.
damagecalculation_yaxis.help_text:
Specify the maximum misincorporation frequency that should be displayed in the damage plot.

> Modifies DamageProfiler parameter: `-yaxis_dp_max` or mapDamage2 parameter: `--ymax`

damagecalculation_xaxis.description: Specify number of bases of each read to be considered for plotting damage estimation.
damagecalculation_xaxis.help_text:
Specify the number of bases to be considered for plotting nucleotide misincorporations.

> Modifies DamageProfiler parameter: `-t` or mapDamage2 parameter: `-m`

damagecalculation_damageprofiler_length.description: Specify the length filter for DamageProfiler.
damagecalculation_damageprofiler_length.help_text:
Specify the number of bases which are considered for frequency computations.

> Modifies DamageProfiler parameter: `-l`

damagecalculation_mapdamage_downsample.description: Specify the maximum number of reads to consider for damage calculation with mapDamage.
damagecalculation_mapdamage_downsample.help_text:
Specify the maximum number of reads used for damage calculation in mapDamage2. This can be used to significantly reduce the amount of time required for damage assessment. Note that a too low value can also obtain incorrect results.

> Modifies mapDamage2 parameter: `-n`

feature_annotation_statistics.title: Feature Annotation Statistics
feature_annotation_statistics.description: Options for calculating reference annotation statistics (e.g. gene coverages)

run_bedtools_coverage.description: Specify to turn on calculation of number of reads, depth and breadth coverage of features in reference with bedtools.
run_bedtools_coverage.help_text:
Specify to turn on the bedtools module, producing statistics for breadth (or percent coverage), and depth (or X fold) coverages.

> Modifies bedtools coverage parameter: `-mean`

mapstats_bedtools_featurefile.description: Specify path to GFF or BED file containing positions of features in reference file for bedtools.
mapstats_bedtools_featurefile.help_text: Specify the path to a GFF/BED containing the feature coordinates (or any acceptable input for [`bedtools coverage`](https://bedtools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/content/tools/coverage.html)). Must be in quotes.

feature_annotation_statistics.help_text:
If you're interested in looking at coverage stats for certain features on your reference such as genes, SNPs etc., you can use the following bedtools module for this purpose.
